description.value:
Trigger A living creature remains in area C4 for at least 1 round

Effect An overwhelming wave of paranoia fills area C4. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save, with the following results. An eerie red eye then opens in the center of the western wall, looking about the room, and the haunt rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 1} and feels like someone or something is watching them for as long as they remain frightened.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 2} and treats no one as an ally as long as they remain frightened.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Confused]{Confused} as long as they remain frightened.

details.description: An overwhelming feeling of being watched wells up in the minds of those in the room, an instant before an eerie red eye opens in the western wall.
details.disable: @Check[type:deception|dc:22|name:Appear Uninteresting|traits:haunt] (trained) to appear uninteresting to the watching eye (and thus be ignored by it) or @Check[type:religion|dc:22|name:Ward Against Being Seen|traits:haunt] (trained) to ward against being seen by or affected by the eye.
details.reset: The haunt becomes inert at the end of any round in which there are no @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} creatures it can see. It stays dormant for 1 hour, after which point it resets.
details.routine:
(1 action) The eye glances about, and those it can see (whether in area C4 or outside of it) take [[/r 4d6[mental]]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:21|basic:true|traits:haunt] save) as fears of being watched impart ripples of pain.

A creature that takes mental damage from this effect doesn't reduce their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} value at the end of their next turn.
